name: 曾乙文
objective:
本課程以敘事性設計的邏輯思維為主體，通過產品設計中設計物件的調研法來展開。從敘事的背景中發現問題，進行事件分析、物關係和使用者特性的剖析，從而在實驗場中培養理論、文化語境和實踐的深度。主要課程分為兩部分。第一部分是設計研究（Design Research）課程，其中包括體驗設計研究和情感化設計的系統理論研究等。在上述課程研究過程中，透過各組的研究專題來進行設計實踐，協助增加研究的多樣性。第二部分是文化敘事的創新設計研究。這部分以敘事學為基礎，將過去的史料與在地發生的事件等，分類為正史、偏史、小說與傳說等，具備故事性質的敘事內容與產品設計語境結合，鍛煉設計師根據不同的故事本源來採集素材，掌握情境中的使用者體驗，其中包含使用者的背景調研、問題分析、使用者性格與習慣等，從中延展出文化產品的另一個層次。在研究的過程中，利用設計尋找文化脈絡，同時將文化根基反饋在設計作品上。

This course centers on the logical thinking of narrative design, using research methods in product design to structure the coursework. It begins with identifying problems through narrative contexts, analyzing events, object relationships, and user characteristics to develop a deep understanding of theory, cultural context, and practical application. The course is divided into two main parts:

Firstly, there is the Design Research segment. This includes experiential design research and system theory research on emotional design. Throughout these research processes, students engage in design practice through individual research projects, enhancing various research dimensions.

Secondly, there is innovative design research in cultural narrative. This segment is grounded in narratology, categorizing historical data and local events into official history, unofficial history, legends, and folktales. These narrative contents with storytelling elements are combined with the context of product design. Students are trained to gather data based on different storylines, understanding user experiences in various scenarios. This includes user background research, problem analysis, and examining user characteristics and habits, extending product design to another level. During the research process, design is used to find cultural contexts, and cultural foundations feedback into the design objects.

name: 楊宙航
objective:
以傳授設計原理、平面及立體設計觀念、美的形式原理、平面及立體的構成練習、對各種視覺媒材特性的應用經驗以及造形與色彩的研究達到對媒體設計感覺的養成，並提高計畫性創造能力，是發展實用性及機能性以前之媒體設計訓練的基礎。
This course aims to develop the ability of students to meet specific sensory needs through the creation of abstract visual order in the form of two-dimension and three-dimension. The visual organization of design elements including line, plane, volume, and the analysis of their abstract relationships and principles of order are studied.
